enrollmentProcess.title: Enrollment Process
enrollmentProcess.description: Join our homeschool community in three simple steps

steps.title: Submit Inquiry
steps.description: Fill out our contact form with your family's information and educational goals
details: Ask any questions you may have

steps.title: Consultation Call
steps.description: Schedule a personalized consultation to discuss your child's needs and our program
details: Review curriculum options and learning approaches
Discuss your child's learning style and interests

steps.title: Complete Enrollment
steps.description: Finalize paperwork and begin your homeschool journey
details: Set up student account and access materials
Receive welcome packet and orientation schedule
Connect with your educational support team

requirements.title: Enrollment Requirements
requirements.description: What you'll need to get started

items: Student's birth certificate or proof of age
Immunization records (as required by state law)
Student's educational history and current grade level
Learning preferences and special needs (if any)
Agreement to program policies and procedures

timeline.title: Enrollment Timeline
timeline.note: Timeline may vary based on individual circumstances and documentation availability

questions.question: When can I enroll my child?
questions.answer: We accept enrollments year-round, allowing families to start when it's best for them. Most families begin at the start of a semester, but mid-year enrollment is welcome.

questions.question: What grades do you serve?
questions.answer: We provide comprehensive curriculum and support for students in kindergarten through 12th grade, with age-appropriate materials and guidance for each level.

questions.question: Is there an application fee?
questions.answer: There is no application fee. We believe in making quality homeschool education accessible to all families. Tuition and material fees are discussed during the consultation.

questions.question: Do I need teaching experience?
questions.answer: No teaching experience is required. We provide comprehensive curriculum, teaching guides, and ongoing support to help parents successfully guide their children's education.

questions.question: What are the state requirements?
questions.answer: Homeschool requirements vary by state. During your consultation, we'll review your state's specific requirements and help ensure you meet all legal obligations.

questions.question: How much time commitment is required?
questions.answer: Time commitment varies by grade level and learning style. Generally, expect 3-5 hours daily for elementary students and 5-7 hours for high school students, plus parent preparation time.

questions.question: What curriculum do you use?
questions.answer: We offer a flexible, comprehensive curriculum covering all core subjects with options for different learning styles. You'll choose materials during consultation based on your child's needs.

questions.question: What support do you provide?
questions.answer: Families receive ongoing educational support including curriculum guidance, teaching resources, progress tracking tools, and access to our community of homeschool families.

questions.question: Can my child participate in extracurricular activities?
questions.answer: Yes! We facilitate connections to co-op classes, field trips, sports programs, and social activities to ensure a well-rounded educational experience.

nextSteps.title: Ready to Get Started?
nextSteps.description: Take the first step toward your child's personalized education

actions.action: Prepare any questions you'd like to discuss

items.description: Curriculum tailored to your child's unique learning style, pace, and interests
Learn on your family's schedule with the freedom to adjust as needed
Ongoing guidance from experienced homeschool educators and support staff
Access to a network of homeschool families for socialization and collaboration
Carefully curated curriculum and resources for all subjects and grade levels
Proven track record of student achievement and college preparation
